trans-unit.source: Variables declared by let have their scope in the block for which they are declared, as well as in any contained sub-blocks. In this way, let works very much like var. The main difference is that the scope of a var variable is the entire enclosing function:

trans-unit.source: Variables declared using var are created before any code is executed in a process known as hoisting. Their initial value is undefined.

Variables declared with var or created by function declarations in non-strict mode do not have block scope. Variables introduced within a block are scoped to the containing function or script, and the effects of setting them persist beyond the block itself. In other words, block statements do not introduce a scope. For example:

Variables declared with vardo not have block scope. Variables introduced with a block are scoped to the containing function or script, and the effects of setting them persist beyond the block itself. In other words, block statements do not introduce a scope. Although "standalone" blocks are valid syntax, you do not want to use standalone blocks in JavaScript, because they don't do what you think they do, if you think they do anything like such blocks in C or Java. For example:
trans-unit.target: Las variables declaradas con var no tienen alcance de bloque. Las variables introducidas con un bloque tienen como alcance la función o el script que las contienen, y los efectos de establecerlas persisten más allá del bloque en sí. En otras palabras, las declaraciones de bloque no introducen un alcance. Aunque los bloques "independientes" son una sintaxis válida, no querrás usar bloques independientes en JavaScript, porque no hacen lo que crees que hacen, si crees que hacen algo como esos bloques en C o Java. trans-unit.source: We can use push to append an element to an array. And, because push accepts a variable number of arguments, we can also push multiple elements at once. But, if we pass an array to push, it will actually add that array as a single element, instead of adding the elements individually, so we end up with an array inside an array. What if that is not what we want? concat does have the behaviour we want in this case, but it does not actually append to the existing array but creates and returns a new array. But we wanted to append to our existing array... So what now? Write a loop? Surely not?
trans-unit.target: Podemos usar push para agregar un elemento a una matriz. Y, como push acepta un número variable de argumentos, también podemos insertar varios elementos a la vez. Pero, si pasamos una matriz para push , en realidad agregará esa matriz como un solo elemento, en lugar de agregar los elementos individualmente, por lo que terminamos con una matriz dentro de una matriz. ¿Y si eso no es lo que queremos? concat tiene el comportamiento que queremos en este caso, pero en realidad no se agrega a la matriz existente, sino que crea y devuelve una nueva matriz. Pero queríamos agregar a nuestra matriz existente ... ¿Y ahora qué? ¿Escribir un bucle? ¿Seguramente no?

When a function is called as a method of an object, its this is set to the object the method is called on.
trans-unit.target: Cuando una función se llama como un método de un objeto, su this se establece en el objeto se llama al método sobre.

trans-unit.source: When a function is called, the arguments to the call are held in the array-like "variable" arguments. For example, in the call "myFn(a, b, c)", the arguments within myFn's body will contain 3 array-like elements corresponding to (a, b, c). When modifying prototypes with hooks, simply pass this & the arguments (the call state) to the current behavior by calling apply() on the function. This pattern can be used for any prototype, such as Node.prototype, Function.prototype, etc.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se llama a una función, los argumentos de la llamada se mantienen en los argumentos "variables" en forma de matriz . Por ejemplo, en la llamada "myFn (a, b, c)", los argumentos dentro del cuerpo de myFn contendrán 3 elementos en forma de matriz correspondientes a (a, b, c). Al modificar prototipos con hooks, simplemente pase esto y los argumentos (el estado de la llamada) al comportamiento actual llamando a apply () en la función. Este patrón se puede utilizar para cualquier prototipo, como Node.prototype, Function.prototype, etc.

trans-unit.source: When a function is called, the arguments to the call are held in the array-like "variable" arguments. For example, in the call myFn(a, b, c), the arguments within myFn's body will contain 3 array-like elements corresponding to (a, b, c).
When a function is used as a constructor (with the new keyword), its this is bound to the new object being constructed.
trans-unit.target: Cuando una función se utiliza como un constructor (con la new palabra clave), su this está obligado a la nueva objeto que está siendo construido.

trans-unit.source: When a function is used as an event handler, its this is set to the element on which the listener is placed (some browsers do not follow this convention for listeners added dynamically with methods other than addEventListener()).

When a function is used as an event handler, its this is set to the element the event fired from (some browsers do not follow this convention for listeners added dynamically with methods other than addEventListener()).
trans-unit.target: Cuando una función se utiliza como un controlador de eventos, su this se establece en el elemento del evento disparado desde (algunos navegadores no siguen esta convención para los oyentes añadido dinámicamente con métodos distintos de addEventListener() ).

trans-unit.source: When a generator is finished, subsequent next() calls will not execute any of that generator's code, they will just return an object of this form: {value: undefined, done: true}.
When a generator is finished, subsequent next calls will not execute any of that generator's code, they will just return an object of this form: {value: undefined, done: true}.
trans-unit.target: Cuando un generador está terminado, las next llamadas posteriores no ejecutarán ninguno de los códigos de ese generador, solo devolverán un objeto de esta forma: {value: undefined, done: true} .

trans-unit.source: When a static or prototype method is called without a value for this, such as by assigning the method to a variable and then calling it, the this value will be undefined inside the method. trans-unit.source: When an exception is thrown in the try block, exception_var (e.g. the e in catch (e)) holds the value specified by the throw statement. You can use this identifier to get information about the exception that was thrown. This identifier is local to the catch clause. That is, it is created when the catch clause is entered, and after the catch clause finishes executing, the identifier is no longer available.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se lanza una excepción en el bloque try , exception_var (por ejemplo, la e en catch (e) ) contiene el valor especificado por la instrucción throw . Puede utilizar este identificador para obtener información sobre la excepción que se lanzó. Este identificador es local para la cláusula catch . Es decir, que se crea cuando el catch se introduce la cláusula, y después de la catch cláusula termina de ejecutarse, el identificador ya no está disponible.

trans-unit.source: When an exception is thrown in the try-block, exception_var (i.e., the e in catch (e)) holds the exception value. You can use this identifier to get information about the exception that was thrown. This identifier is only available in the catch-block's scope. If you don't need the exception value, it could be omitted.

When called with a buffer, and optionally a byteOffset and a length argument, a new typed array view is created that views the specified ArrayBuffer. The byteOffset and length parameters specify the memory range that will be exposed by the typed array view. If both are omitted, all of buffer is viewed; if only length is omitted, the remainder of buffer is viewed.

When called with a buffer, and optionally a byteOffset and a length argument, a new typed array view is created that views the specified ArrayBuffer. The byteOffset and length parameters specify the memory range that will be exposed by the typed array view. If both are omitted, all of buffer is viewed; if only length is omitted, the remainder of buffer is viewed.
When called with a length argument, an internal array buffer is created in memory, of size length multiplied by BYTES_PER_ELEMENT bytes, containing zeros.

When called with a typedArray argument, which can be an object of any of the typed array types (such as Int32Array), the typedArray gets copied into a new typed array. Each value in typedArray is converted to the corresponding type of the constructor before being copied into the new array. The length of the new typed array will be same as the length of the typedArray argument.

trans-unit.target: Cuando se llama con un buffer y, opcionalmente, un byteOffset y un argumento de length , se crea una nueva vista de matriz con tipo que ve el ArrayBuffer especificado . Los parámetros byteOffset y length especifican el rango de memoria que será expuesto por la vista de matriz escrita. trans-unit.source: When called with a typedArray argument, which can be an object of any of the typed array types (such as Int32Array), the typedArray gets copied into a new typed array. When comparing a number and a string, the string is converted to a number value. JavaScript attempts to convert the string numeric literal to a Number type value. First, a mathematical value is derived from the string numeric literal. Next, this value is rounded to nearest Number type value.

Primero, un valor matemático se deriva de la cadena literal numérica. A continuación, este valor se redondea al valor de tipo de Number más cercano .

trans-unit.source: When found, separator is removed from the string, and the substrings are returned in an array.

When found, separator is removed from the string and the substrings are returned in an array. If separator is not found or is omitted, the array contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters. If separator appears at the beginning or end of the string, or both, the array begins, ends, or both begins and ends, respectively, with an empty string. Thus, if the string consists solely of one instance of separator, the array consists of two empty strings.
trans-unit.target: Cuando se encuentra, el separator se elimina de la cadena y las subcadenas se devuelven en una matriz. Si el separator no se encuentra o se omite, la matriz contiene un elemento que consta de toda la cadena. Si el separator es una cadena vacía, str se convierte en una matriz de caracteres. Si el separator aparece al principio o al final de la cadena, o ambos, la matriz comienza, termina o ambos comienzan y terminan, respectivamente, con una cadena vacía. Por lo tanto, si la cadena consta únicamente de una instancia de separator , la matriz consta de dos cadenas vacías.

trans-unit.source: When the property already exists, Object.defineProperty() attempts to modify the property according to the values in the descriptor and the object's current configuration. If the old descriptor had its configurable attribute set to false the property is said to be “non-configurable”. It is not possible to change any attribute of a non-configurable accessor property. For data properties, it is possible to modify the value if the property is writable, and it is possible to change writable attribute from true to false. It is not possible to switch between data and accessor property types when the property is non-configurable.
trans-unit.target: Cuando la propiedad ya existe, Object.defineProperty() intenta modificar la propiedad de acuerdo con los valores del descriptor y la configuración actual del objeto. Si el descriptor antiguo tenía su atributo configurable establecido en false , se dice que la propiedad es "no configurable". No es posible cambiar ningún atributo de una propiedad de acceso no configurable. Para las propiedades de datos, es posible modificar el valor de la propiedad si se puede escribir, y es posible cambiar writable atributo de true a false . No es posible cambiar entre los tipos de propiedad de acceso y datos cuando la propiedad no es configurable.

trans-unit.target: Cuando el método exec() expresión regular encuentra una coincidencia, devuelve una matriz que contiene primero toda la parte coincidente de la cadena y luego las partes de la cadena que coinciden con cada grupo entre paréntesis en la expresión regular. La asignación de desestructuración le permite desempacar las partes de esta matriz fácilmente, ignorando la coincidencia completa si no es necesaria.

trans-unit.source: When wrapped in an Object, a BigInt will be considered as a normal "object" type:

When you calculate log(1 + x), you should get an answer very close to x, if x is small (that's why these are called 'natural' logarithms). If you calculate Math.log(1 + 1.1111111111e-15) you should get an answer close to 1.1111111111e-15. Instead, you will end up taking the logarithm of 1.00000000000000111022 (the roundoff is in binary so sometimes it gets ugly), so you get the answer 1.11022...e-15, with only 3 correct digits. If, instead, you calculate Math.log1p(1.1111111111e-15) you will get a much more accurate answer 1.1111111110999995e-15 with 15 correct digits of precision (actually 16 in this case).
trans-unit.target: Cuando calculas log(1+x),deber√≠as obtener una respuesta muy cercana a x,si x es peque√±a (por eso se llaman logaritmos "naturales").Si calculas Math.log(1+1.1111111111e-15)deber√≠as obtener una respuesta cercana a 1.1111111111e-15.En cambio,terminar√°s tomando el logaritmo de 1.00000000000000111022 (el redondeo est√° en binario,as√≠ que a veces se pone feo),as√≠ que obtienes la respuesta 1.11022...e-15,con s√≥lo 3 d√≠gitos correctos.Si,en cambio,calculas Math.log1p(1.1111111111e-15)obtendr√°s una respuesta mucho m√°s precisa 1.1111111110999995e-15 con 15 d√≠gitos correctos de precisi√≥n (en realidad 16 en este caso).

trans-unit.target: Cuando desee saber si se encuentra un patrón y también su índice en una cadena, use search() (si solo desea saber si existe, use el método test() similar en el prototipo RegExp, que devuelve un booleano); para obtener más información (pero una ejecución más lenta) use match() (similar al método exec() expresión regular ).

trans-unit.source: While the previous example may be more useful for programs that must support non-BMP characters (since it does not require the caller to know where any non-BMP character might appear), in the event that one does wish, in choosing a character by index, to treat the surrogate pairs within a string as the single characters they represent, one can use the following:

While there is a mathematical relationship between the supplementary code point value (e.g. 0x1F303) and both surrogate values that represent it (e.g., 0xD83C and 0xDF03), it does require an extra step to either calculate or look up the surrogate pair values every time a supplementary code point is to be used. For this reason, it's more convenient to use String.fromCodePoint() (part of the ES2015 standard), which allows for returning supplementary characters based on their actual code point value. For example, String.fromCodePoint(0x1F303) returns code point U+1F303 "Night with Stars".

trans-unit.source: Why are Array and ArrayBuffer length limited? The length property of an Array or an ArrayBuffer is represented with an unsigned 32-bit integer, that can only store values which are in the range from 0 to 232-1.

trans-unit.source: Why should I have semicolons after return statements? In the case of semicolon-less return statements, it can be unclear whether the developer intended to return the statement on the following line, or to stop execution and return. The warning indicates that there is ambiguity in the way the return statement is written.
trans-unit.target: ¿Por qué debería tener punto y coma después de las declaraciones de return ? En el caso de declaraciones de return punto y coma , puede no estar claro si el desarrollador tenía la intención de devolver la instrucción en la siguiente línea o detener la ejecución y regresar. La advertencia indica que hay ambigüedad en la forma en que se escribe la declaración de return .
